clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Galcanezumab (LY2951742) in Participants 12 to 17 Years of Age With Chronic Migraine
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study of Galcanezumab in Adolescent Patients 12 to 17 Years of Age With Chronic Migraine - the REBUILD-2 Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of galcanezumab for the preventive treatment of chronic migraine in participants 12 to 17 years of age. The primary objective is to demonstrate the superiority of galcanezumab versus placebo in the reduction of monthly migraine headache days across the 3-month double-blind treatment period.

detailed_description.textblock: The study includes a 3-month, randomized, double-blind treatment period in which participants receive either galcanezumab or placebo, followed by a 9-month open-label extension in which all participants receive galcanezumab. Enrollment in the European Union may also include participants 6 to 11 years of age.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Reduction from Baseline ≥30%, ≥50%, ≥75% and 100% in Monthly Migraine Headache Days
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with Reduction from Baseline ≥30%, ≥50%, ≥75% and 100% in Monthly Migraine Headache Days

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days with Nausea and/or Vomiting
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days with Nausea and/or Vomiting

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days with Photophobia and Phonophobia
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days with Photophobia and Phonophobia

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headaches with Prodromal Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headaches with Prodromal Symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days on Which Acute Headache Medication is Taken
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Migraine Headache Days on Which Acute Headache Medication is Taken

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Severity of Remaining Migraine Headaches per Month
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Severity of Remaining Migraine Headaches per Month

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Headache Days
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in the Number of Monthly Headache Days

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline on the PedsQL Total Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline on the Pediatric Migraine Disability Assessment test (PedMIDAS) Total Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline on the PedMIDAS Total Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Suicidal Ideation and Behaviors Assessed by the Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with Suicidal Ideation and Behaviors Assessed by the C-SSRS Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of Calcitonin Gene-Related Peptide (CGRP)
Percentage of Participants Developing Anti-Drug Antibodies
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants Developing Anti-Drug Antibodies

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants who Initiate Migraine Prevention Medication in the Post-Treatment Follow-Up Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants who Initiate Migraine Prevention Medication in the Post-Treatment Follow-Up Phase

arm_group.description: Galcanezumab administered by SQ injection. Participants may be eligible for optional open-label extension at the end of the double-blind period.
Placebo administered by SQ injection. Participants may be eligible for optional open-label extension at the end of the double-blind period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a diagnosis of chronic migraine as defined by the IHS ICHD-3 guidelines (1.3 according to ICHD-3 [2018]), that is, a headache occurring on 15 or more days per month for at least the last 3 months, which has the features of migraine headache on at least 8 days per month.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who are taking, or are expected to take, therapeutic antibodies during the course of the study (adalimumab, infliximab, trastuzumab, bevacizumab, etc.). Prior use of therapeutic antibodies, other than antibodies to calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) or its receptor, is allowed if that use was more than 12 months prior to baseline.
- Known hypersensitivity to multiple drugs, monoclonal antibodies or other therapeutic proteins, or to galcanezumab or its excipients.
- Current use or prior exposure to galcanezumab, another CGRP antibody, or CGRP receptor antibody, including those who have previously completed or withdrawn from this study or any other study investigating a CGRP antibody.
- History of persistent daily headache, cluster headache or migraine subtypes including hemiplegic (sporadic or familial) migraine and migraine with brainstem aura (previously basilar-type migraine) as defined by IHS ICHD-3.
- History of significant head or neck injury within 6 months prior to screening; or traumatic head injury at any time that is associated with significant change in the quality or frequency of their headaches, including new onset of migraine following traumatic head injury.
- Participants with a known history of intracranial tumors or developmental malformations including Chiari malformations.

link.description: A Study of Galcanezumab (LY2951742) in Participants 12 to 17 Years of Age With Chronic Migraine (REBUILD-2)

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymized individual patient level data will be provided in a secure access environment upon approval of a research proposal and a signed data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data are available 6 months after the primary publication and approval of the indication studied in the US and EU, whichever is later. Data will be indefinitely available for requesting.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A research proposal must be approved by an independent review panel and researchers must sign a data sharing agreement.
